document.name: WhereToHongKong

sentence.text: He was looking not for a new policy for Britain , but for a political protege for himself , someone who would be more gracious and romantic than Chamberlain .

It might have been slightly more gracious of him to pay tribute to the work of my right hon. Friend the Prime Minister in getting this universal and non-discriminatory register of arms transfers recom-mended to the Assembly .
Her Majesty the Empress was very gracious to us , but that was all .
` You 're being very gracious with me this evening . "
He waved the matter away with a gracious gesture .
Chris Davis , the paper 's assistant editor , said last night : ` It is Mr Rupert Murdoch who feels we should make this handsome and gracious gesture .
` A gracious lady , my liege , whose gracious gift I mean to wear to war , as I have ever done in peace . "
" This sure is mighty civilized of you , m'sieur , to look after us like this , " he drawled , letting a gracious smile play across his face .
He 'd taken her to church , he 'd taken her to lunch and she had n't been particularly gracious about any of it .
` Your ancestors were gracious to their servants , Nuadu of the Silver Arm , " he said , sneeringly .
When there is a Labour Government and the Leader of the House finds himself sitting on the Opposition Benches , that Administration will be gracious to the then Opposition .
In his victory speech he was gracious towards Brown and Tsongas voters , saying they were united with his supporters in wanting to oust Mr Bush .
` Where did you find them ? " the American woman asked , expressing gracious interest .
In the name of Allah , Most Gracious , Most Merciful . ( T.C : verse from the Koran )
In the name of Allah , Most Gracious , Most Merciful .
Knowledgeable visitors look for antiques - either Chinese heirlooms or leftovers from the gracious Portuguese colonial days .
